title: Transfer news: Mario Mandzukic 'will need to lower wage demands' to secure Man United move
text:
Mario Mandzukic will have to lower his wage demands if he is to force through a move to Manchester United in January.

Funds will be made available to improve the squad after a dismal start to the new season under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

Croatian striker Mandzukic is among the targets, but United are eager to not be 'held to ransom over fees and wages', according to ESPN.

Manchester United are targeting a move for Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic

United are desperate for bodies in attack with Marcus Rashford, Anthony Martial and Mason Greenwood their only recognised strikers.

Solskjaer's side have slipped to 12th in the table, just two points above the relegation zone.

Mandzukic is craving first-team football having failed to make a single appearance for Juventus this season.

The 33-year-old has fallen down the pecking order after the resurgence of Gonzalo Higuain and is out of favour.

Last season the Croat scored 10 goals in 33 appearances.

Massimiliano Allegri is widely tipped to take over at Old Trafford if Solskjaer is shown the door and he knows Mandzukic well have enjoyed a trophy-laden spell at Juventus with him.

Allegri stepped down in the summer after five straight Serie A titles.
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is set to be handed funds to improve his Manchester United squad in the January window after a dismal start to the new season.
